DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare degree stent malapposition immediate optical coherence tomography ( OCT ) nominal stent pressure final post-procedure OCT ( ANCHOR-I ) neointimal coverage 3-months OCT follow intervention randomly assign two drug-eluting stent ( DES ) , PromusTMElementTM stents versus Xience PRIME® stent .
DOC.brief_title: Assessment Stent Malapposition Neointimal Coverage Optical coHerence Tomography Post-procedure 3 Months After Platinum Chromium Alloy Of Element™ Stent Implantation
DOC.criteria: Patient ≥ 20 year old Significant coronary de novo lesion ( > 70 % quantitative angiographic analysis ) treat single DES vessel . Patients stable angina consider coronary revascularization stent implantation . Reference vessel diameter 2.5 3.5 mm operator assessment Complex lesion morphology aortoostial , unprotected leave main , chronic total occlusion , graft , thrombosis , restenosis Reference vessel diameter < 2.5 mm > 4.0mm lesion length > 28 mm Heavy calcify lesion ( definite calcify lesion angiogram ) Lesions require 2 DES vessel Acute coronary syndrome Contraindication antiplatelet agent Treated DES within 3 month vessel Creatinine level ≥ 2.0 mg/dL ESRD Severe hepatic dysfunction ( 3 time normal reference value ) Pregnant woman woman potential childbearing Life expectancy 1 year
